title: Gender, Politics, and Development in Timor-Leste

questions.question: What percentage of seats in Timor-Leste's national parliament are currently held by women?
Which of the following is NOT a key challenge to women's political participation in Timor-Leste?
choices: Cultural norms and traditional gender roles
Lack of gender quotas in parliament
questions.answer: Lack of gender quotas in parliament

questions.question: What is the term for assessing the implications of any planned action on both women and men?
What is the minimum ratio of women candidates required on party lists for parliamentary elections in Timor-Leste?
Which level of governance in Timor-Leste continues to be male-dominated despite progress in national representation?
What is Timor-Leste's ranking on the Gender Development Index (as of 2019)?
What percentage of women in Timor-Leste report experiencing intimate partner violence in their lifetime?
Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a strategy to improve women's political participation in Timor-Leste?
choices: Mandatory retirement age for male politicians
questions.answer: Mandatory retirement age for male politicians

questions.question: What type of system is Timor-Leste's government structure described as?
What is the difference between male and female literacy rates in Timor-Leste (as of 2018)?
Which of the following is cited as a potential benefit of increasing women's political empowerment in Timor-Leste?
choices: More inclusive and sustainable development outcomes
questions.answer: More inclusive and sustainable development outcomes

questions.question: What percentage of Suco chiefs in Timor-Leste are women (as of 2016)?
Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a focus area for women in leadership positions according to research?
What is the term for a specified minimum number or percentage of women required in political positions?
Which of the following best describes the relationship between numerical representation and substantive participation of women in politics?
choices: Numerical representation does not automatically translate to substantive participation
Substantive participation always leads to increased numerical representation
questions.answer: Numerical representation does not automatically translate to substantive participation

questions.question: What is the difference between male and female labor force participation rates in Timor-Leste (as of 2019)?
Which of the following is described as the lowest level of government in Timor-Leste?
What year did Timor-Leste gain independence?
Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a challenge in implementing gender mainstreaming in Timor-Leste?
What type of intervention has been shown to enhance women's political efficacy and willingness to engage in public life?
Which of the following is described as a legacy influencing political participation in Timor-Leste?
What percentage of Suco council members in Timor-Leste are women (as of 2016)?
Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a strategy for improving women's political participation in Timor-Leste?
What is the term for the process of increasing the capacity of individuals or groups to make choices and transform those choices into desired actions and outcomes in the political sphere?
Which of the following is described as a social system in which men hold primary power and predominate in roles of political leadership?
What year did Timor-Leste introduce a quota system for women's representation in Suco councils?
Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a potential challenge for women entering politics in Timor-Leste?
choices: Lack of support from political parties

questions.question: What type of interventions have been successful in changing attitudes towards women in leadership positions?
Which of the following best describes Timor-Leste's progress in promoting gender equality in politics?
choices: Significant progress has been made, but challenges persist
All gender equality goals have been achieved
Progress has been made only at the national level
questions.answer: Significant progress has been made, but challenges persist

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of gender mainstreaming in Timor-Leste?
choices: To promote gender equality across all sectors
questions.answer: To promote gender equality across all sectors
